-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please go to the following website for detailed information:
 <a href="
http://www.hkmdb.com/db/movies/view.mhtml?id=8816&display_set=eng" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.hkmdb.com/db/movies/view.mhtml?id=8816&display_set=eng</a>

"During the Japanese occupation of Shanghai, a Chinese woman trains in the covert arts. When she arrives in Hong Kong, she learns that her brother works on behalf the Japanese cause. She then pulls together a team of women warriors to stop her brother."

This movie is the Hong Kong version of an exploitation movie that mixes in kung fu fights. When the ladies are wearing their red ninja costumes, the fights are serious, but when they are not, the viewer is treated to training sequences in modern bikinis, mud wrestling and oil wrestling scenes.
 The movie is set during the Japanese invasion of China, but the clothes, cars and hair styles are modern. The villians put a comic-book-superhero touch to the film. The head kung fu villian has a spider tatoo instead of hair, and the others wear colorful costumes and have gimmicks, like a spider web to trap their foes.
   The movie is full screen, but manages to avoid the "empty screen" effect of people talking but no one is on the screen. The fights are affected as some action takes place off screen.
 The print is fairly clear, but has scratches and blemishes that show up now and again. It is dubbed in English using the funny voices that indicate cheap dubbing. 
  If you want action, babes in bikinis - or nude - and mix in alot of Kung Fu then this is your film to watch!
